Class View

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
View
public class View
extends javafx.application.Application
General class for handling the navigation through the program. Contains each Screen that will be shown to the user and defines how they interact by calling each Screen's methods accordingly.
Author:
Takiyah Price
See Also:
Screen

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

    javafx.application.Application.Parameters

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class javafx.application.Application

    STYLESHEET_CASPIAN, STYLESHEET_MODENA

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    View()
    Constructor for the View that creates the Controller and passes itself into the Controller's constructor and creates a FileChooser for when when the user loads a saved design.

    Creates the GridPane representing the garden based on the GardenPlot in Model, drawing in inactive tiles if the grid is to be used in the design mode or removing the inactive tiles if the grid is to be used in the final view or season view.

    Closes the application, meaning all windows are closed.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] tofu)
      Calls launch to start the application.

      Parameters:
      tofu - string array of arguments

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage theStage)
      Takes in parameter theStage and uses it to initialize its reference to the primary Stage

      Start is used to for the start of the program where it starts with the main menu

      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      theStage - The primary stage, which will be set with mainMenuScreen's scene.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Closes the application, meaning all windows are closed.

    • getDesignGardenScreen

      public DesignGarden getDesignGardenScreen()
      Returns the designGardenScreen, which handles the screen for editing the garden.
      Returns:
      the Screen designGardenScreen, which handles the Scene and visual components of the screen where the user can edit their garden.

    • goToLastScreen

      public void goToLastScreen()
      Goes to the last Screen and sets currentPrimaryScreen back one Screen to reflect the change.

    • show

      public void show​(java.lang.String screen)
      Makes the Screen specified by the given String visible to the user by invoking the necessary Screen's showScreen method, and handles the presentation of the save and load dialogs.
      Parameters:
      screen - the String representing the name of the Screen to be shown
      See Also:
      Screen, Screen.showScreen()

    • showSaveLoad

      public java.io.File showSaveLoad​(boolean isSaving)
      Shows a save or load dialog depending on whether the user pressed a save or load button, momentarily lowering the opacity of the primaryStage behind it to visually communicate that it cannot be accessed while the dialog is open.
      Parameters:
      isSaving - a boolean specifying whether to open a save or load dialog; true for a save dialog and false for an open dialog.
      Returns:
      the File returned by the FileChooser; null if the user cancelled the process, a new File if the user is saving a design and an existing File if the user is loading an design.

    • mouseEntered

      public void mouseEntered​(java.lang.Object o)
      Calls the appropriate Screen's methods to manage the mouse entering a Node belonging to that Screen. Behavior is relative to the current primary Screen being shown to the user. To be called by the Controller.
      Parameters:
      o - an Object, the source of the mouseEntered event being handled, which can be cast relative to the current Screen.
      See Also:
      Controller.mouseClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent)

    • mouseExited

      public void mouseExited​(java.lang.Object o)
      Calls the appropriate Screen's methods to manage the mouse exiting a Node belonging to that Screen. Behavior is relative to the current primary Screen being shown to the user. To be called by the Controller.
      Parameters:
      o - an Object, the source of the mouseExited event being handled, which can be cast relative to the current Screen.
      See Also:
      Controller.mouseExit(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent)

    • mouseClicked

      public void mouseClicked​(java.lang.Object o)
      Calls the appropriate Screen's methods to manage the mouse clicking a Node belonging to that Screen. Behavior is relative to the current primary Screen being shown to the user. To be called by the Controller.
      Parameters:
      o - an Object, the source of the mouseClicked event being handled, which can be cast relative to the current Screen.
      See Also:
      Controller.mouseClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent)

    • getCurrentTotalPrefs

      public int getCurrentTotalPrefs()
      Returns the total preferences that need to be filled from preferencesScreen.
      Returns:
      the total preferences that need to filled based on the template currently chosen.

    • sendTemplate

      public java.lang.String sendTemplate()
      Gets the String representation of the template selected by the user on the Choose Template Screen. To be called by the Controller in order to update the model with the shape.
      Returns:
      the name of the selected template as a String.
      See Also:
      ChooseTemplate.getSelectedTemplate()

    • getCurrentPrimaryScreen

      public java.lang.String getCurrentPrimaryScreen()
      Returns the String representation of the current primary Screen being viewed.

    • loadPreferences

      public void loadPreferences​(java.lang.String colorPref, java.lang.String seasonPref, int waterPref, int lightPref, int lengthPref, int widthPref)
      Passes the user preferences to the preferences screen to set up the Screen when loading a saved design with unfinished preferences.
      Parameters:
      colorPref - The user preferred color for the plants.
      seasonPref - The user preferred season to view the plants in while designing.
      waterPref - The general water availability specified by the user.
      lightPref - The general light availability specified by the user.
      lengthPref - The length of the garden if rectangular, or the number of rows if triangular.
      widthPref - The width of the garden.

    • createNew

      public void createNew()
      Reinstantiates the templates, preferences, design, final view, recommendations, and season view Screens as well as infoTips. To be called when the user clicks the 'Create New Garden' button from the main menu.

    • getSeasonViewScreen

      public SeasonView getSeasonViewScreen()
      Returns the SeasonView Screen.
      Returns:
      the SeasonView Screen.
      See Also:
      SeasonView

    • getFinalViewScreen

      public FinalView getFinalViewScreen()
      Returns the FinalView Screen.
      Returns:
      the FinalView Screen.
      See Also:
      FinalView

    • drawGrid

      public static javafx.scene.layout.GridPane drawGrid​(Controller con, boolean drawInactiveTiles)
      Creates the GridPane representing the garden based on the GardenPlot in Model, drawing in inactive tiles if the grid is to be used in the design mode or removing the inactive tiles if the grid is to be used in the final view or season view.
      Parameters:
      con - The Controller, which handles the flow of information between the View and Model.
      drawInactiveTiles - A boolean indicating whether to add the image for inactive tiles or to remove the space entirely.
      Returns:
      A GridPane, in which the user will drag plants into or view in different seasons.

    • setActiveImg

      public void setActiveImg​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView soilIV, boolean active)
      Changes the given empty soil ImageView in the DesignGarden screen's GridPane to the image for an active tile if the boolean 'active' is true or for an inactive tile is active is false. To be called by the controller when the user has chosen the custom template and clicks an empty tile.
      Parameters:
      soilIV - the ImageView being set with a new Image.
      active - a boolean, true if soilIV is being set with the Image for an active tile and false if it is being set with the Image for an inactive tile.

    • dragTileEditors

      public void dragTileEditors​(javafx.scene.Node n)
      Handles the visual effect of dragging the tile editor across the screen.
      Parameters:
      n - the Node being dragged.
